## Profile summary

Steve is a Data Scientist and Machine Leaning Engineer with strong mathematical, statistical and computational skills. He previously worked in the intersection of computational approaches and public health; and is greatly involved in the R open-source community and passionate about developing R packages. He has vast experience in data processing, analysis and mining; predictive modelling; machine learning and algorithm implementation.

Currently, he is a data scientist at African Population and Health Center and a Research Fellow with I-DAIR. Previously, he  worked with Dalberg research as a data processing manager and African Population and Health Research Centre as a data scientist, both in Nairobi, Kenya. He also collaborates with [MacTheobio](https://mac-theobio.github.io/) research group.

Steve holds a PhD in Computational Science and Engineering (under supervision of [Prof. Jonathan Dushoff](https://mac-theobio.github.io/dushoff.html) and [Prof. Benjamin Bolker](https://math.mcmaster.ca/~bolker/)) from McMaster University (Canada), an MSc in Mathematical Sciences from Stellenbosch University (South Africa) and a BSc in Applied Statistics with Computing from Maasai Mara University (Kenya).
